alert.note: Alert for Andrews; Ector; Glasscock; Martin; Midland (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 1:03AM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN GLASSCOCK... NORTHEASTERN ECTOR...SOUTHEASTERN ANDREWS...NORTHERN MIDLAND... SOUTHWESTERN HOWARD AND SOUTHERN MARTIN COUNTIES THROUGH 145 AM CDT... At 103 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northwest of Midland, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Midland, Greenwood, Stanton, Lenorah, Courtney, Midland Airpark, and Stanton Municipal Aiport. This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 142 and 161. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
